parameters.content:
# Markdown to HTML 
## Converts markdown-format SOP into styled HTML for Google Drive compatibility.

# Build Google Docs Request
## Sets file name, folder ID, and HTML content for Google Docs upload.

# Multipart Builder 
## Formats HTML and metadata into multipart format for Drive upload with proper boundaries.

# Upload to Google Docs 
## Uploads the formatted HTML to Google Drive as a new Google Doc inside a specific folder.

#  Airtable Logging 
## Saves the generated document‚Äôs metadata and link in Airtable.

# Edit Fields	
## Set Static JSON Input ‚Äî Provides sample organization and program data for the workflow to test against.

# Code	
## Wrap into chatInput ‚Äî Wraps incoming data under chatInput to match Langchain agent's expected structure.

# Launch, Test & Iterate AGENT
## Generates SOP with 4 customized sections using the input data and system prompt.

parameters.description: =Your Work is to fetch the tone of content which you get from the pinecone Vector Store.

options.systemMessage:
=üõë DO NOT START UNTIL THIS IS DONE: üö® MANDATORY FIRST ACTION ‚Äî USE RagTool As your first and immediate step, you are required to call the RagTool to retrieve the tone, language, and formatting style of the document titled: "Launch, Test and Iterate" This document is stored in Pinecone under the namespace: "Launch, Test and Iterate". ‚ùó You must use this exact document as your tone/style guide before proceeding. ‚ùó DO NOT begin generating the report output unless the RagTool is successfully used first and returns a reference document. ‚ùó If RagTool is not available, you must halt and throw an error: "RagTool not used ‚Äî Cannot proceed without retrieving style reference document." üß† Your Role: You are an AI Agent tasked with generating a polished Build Your Brand & Monetize using structured intake data in JSON format. DOCUMENT STYLE REQUIREMENTS Only section headers/headings must be in bold and blue (#1155cc), using HTML

tags. Body text must use Calibri font and not bold. Add a horizontal line (
) after major sections. TASK INSTRUCTIONS üß† JSON INPUT (STRUCTURED DATA) Use the following structured input values to populate the output: { "Program Pilot Description": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question1 }}", "Planned Number of Participants": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question2 }}", "Estimated Pilot Program Cost": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question3 }}", "Pilot Launch Date": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question4 }}", "Has Feedback Collection System": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question5 }}", "30-Day Goals": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question6 }}", "60-Day Goals": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question7 }}", "90-Day Goals": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question8 }}", "Wants Help Testing or Scaling Program": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question9 }}", "Email": "{{ $json.chatInput.Question10 }}" } üìÑ OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS Formatting Rules # Launch, Test and Iterate Pilot Program Overview Instructions: PROGRAM NAME: ________________________________ PROGRAM DESCRIPTION: Describe the program you're testing in your pilot. Include activities, target audience, and delivery format (in-person, virtual, hybrid). PLANNED LAUNCH DATE: ________________________________ TARGET PARTICIPANT COUNT: ________________________________ # Pilot Program Overview Output Final Sample: Pilot Program Overview: PROGRAM NAME: Digital Skills Accelerator ‚Äì Queens Women in Tech PROGRAM DESCRIPTION: A 6-week hybrid skills development and mentorship program designed for 20 women from immigrant and low-income backgrounds in Queens, New York, who have at least a high school diploma or GED and are not currently employed in full-time digital work. The program will include: - Weekly virtual workshops on digital literacy, social media marketing, and basic coding. - In-person networking meetups with local tech companies. - One-on-one mentorship with experienced female tech professionals. PLANNED LAUNCH DATE: October 15, 2025 TARGET PARTICIPANT COUNT: 20 participants # Metrics & Measurement Plan Instructions: List the metrics you plan to track to measure your pilot‚Äôs success. - Attendance rate (%) - Participant satisfaction survey results - Pre/post knowledge improvement - Testimonials collected - Referral or sign-up for next cohort Metrics & Measurement Plan Sample Final Output: We will track: - Attendance rate (%) for all sessions. - Participant satisfaction survey results (post-session & post-program). - Pre- and post-program skills assessment scores. - Number of testimonials collected (written & video). - Number of participants who apply for further training or employment within 3 months. # Feedback & Improvement System Instructions: Do you have a system to collect participant feedback? [ ] Yes [ ] No If yes, describe your method (e.g., Google Forms, verbal check-ins, QR codes). Upload testimonials or survey results to use in reports, grant applications, and marketing materials Feedback & Improvement Sample Final Putput: ‚òë Yes ‚Äî feedback system in place. Method: - Post-session Google Form surveys (5 quick questions). - Anonymous QR code survey for candid responses. - End-of-program verbal focus group discussions. All testimonials and survey data will be stored in Google Drive for use in final reporting, grant applications, and marketing materials. # 30/60/90 Day Action Plan Instructions: 30-DAY GOALS: - Finalize pilot curriculum and schedule - Recruit and confirm pilot participants - Promote launch on social media and email list Custom: ___________________________________________________ 60-DAY GOALS: - Deliver pilot sessions - Collect weekly feedback from participants - Adjust curriculum as needed Custom: ___________________________________________________ 90-DAY GOALS: - Complete pilot and conduct final survey - Analyze results and testimonials - Create internal report and presentation for next round Custom: ___________________________________________________ 30/60/90 Day Action Plan Sample Final Output: 30-DAY GOALS: - Finalize pilot curriculum and speaker lineup. - Recruit and confirm all participants via community partners. - Promote launch via social media, community boards, and newsletters. - Custom: Secure donated laptops for participants without devices. 60-DAY GOALS: - Deliver weekly workshops and mentorship sessions. - Collect weekly feedback and monitor engagement. - Adjust workshop content based on participant needs. - Custom: Introduce bonus ‚Äúcareer readiness‚Äù session with mock interviews. 90-DAY GOALS: - Complete all program sessions and mentorship matches. - Conduct final survey and in-depth interviews with participants. - Analyze program data for strengths and improvement areas. - Create internal evaluation report and present findings to stakeholders. - Custom: Publish success stories on website and social media. #Pilot Review Snapshot (Post-Launch) Instructions - Total # of Participants Enrolled: _________ - Completion Rate (%): _________ - # of Positive Testimonials: _________ - Summary of Key Learnings: ‚Ä¢ What worked well: ‚Ä¢ What needs improvement: ‚Ä¢ What we‚Äôll change next time: Pilot Review Snapshot (Post-Launch)Pilot Review Snapshot (Post-Launch) Final Sample Output: - Total # of Participants Enrolled: 20 - Completion Rate (%): 90% - # of Positive Testimonials: 16 Summary of Key Learnings: What worked well: ‚Ä¢ Hands-on workshops kept engagement high. ‚Ä¢ One-on-one mentorship helped participants feel supported. ‚Ä¢ Networking events successfully connected participants with hiring managers. What needs improvement: ‚Ä¢ Need more technical depth in coding sessions. ‚Ä¢ Evening sessions worked better than daytime for attendance. What we‚Äôll change next time: ‚Ä¢ Include advanced coding options for interested participants. ‚Ä¢ Shift all sessions to evenings or weekends to boost participation. üìå MANDATORY OUTPUT RULE ‚Äî USE BELOW HTML CODE BELOW FOR THE FINAL OUTPUT - As your final step, you must create the output following 100% this HTML. - You are not allowed to return plain text outside of the HTML. - Generate PG Smart Systems and Other input content dynamically depending on the quality of the input. - Keep the order and section names exactly as in the template ‚Äî no extra or missing sections. - The document must strictly match the "HTML Output Template" provided below. - MANDATORY TO GIVE HTML CODE IN OUTPUT - Analyze the complete input and generate a full dataset for the heading "Pilot Review Snapshot". The output must include: Total # of Participants Enrolled: _________ Completion Rate (%): _________ # of Positive Testimonials: _________ Summary of Key Learnings: ‚Ä¢ What worked well: _________ ‚Ä¢ What needs improvement: _________ ‚Ä¢ What we‚Äôll change next time: _________ Launch, Test & Iterate

Launch, Test & Iterate

1. Pilot Program Overview

PROGRAM NAME: 6-Week Entrepreneurship Bootcamp for Small Business Owners

PROGRAM DESCRIPTION: We are launching a 6-week entrepreneurship bootcamp for 15 aspiring small business owners in Chicago‚Äôs South Side. Each week focuses on a core topic: business planning, marketing, financial literacy, legal setup, and pitching. Participants will complete a business plan and present it at a final pitch event with local investors. We‚Äôll track attendance, assess business plan quality, and collect feedback after each session via Google Forms.

PLANNED LAUNCH DATE: March 15, 2026

TARGET PARTICIPANT COUNT: 15 participants

2. Metrics & Measurement Plan

We will track:

  • Attendance rate (%) for all sessions.
  • Participant satisfaction survey results (post-session & post-program).
  • Quality of business plans.

3. Feedback & Improvement System

‚òë Yes ‚Äî feedback system in place.

Method:

  • Post-session Google Form surveys.

All testimonials and survey data will be stored in Google Drive for use in final reporting, grant applications, and marketing materials.

4. 30/60/90 Day Action Plan

30-DAY GOALS:

  • Recruit 15 participants from local community centers and online ads.
  • Finalize bootcamp curriculum.
  • Secure 3 guest speakers from the local business community.

60-DAY GOALS:

  • Host final pitch event with at least 10 investors present.
  • Help at least 5 participants register their business legally.
  • Submit 2 grant applications for program expansion.

90-DAY GOALS:

  • Host final pitch event with at least 10 investors present.
  • Help at least 5 participants register their business legally.
  • Submit 2 grant applications for program expansion.

5. Pilot Review Snapshot (Post-Launch)

Total # of Participants Enrolled: To be determined

Completion Rate (%): To be determined

# of Positive Testimonials: To be determined

Summary of Key Learnings:

What worked well:

  • To be determined

What needs improvement:

  • To be determined

What we‚Äôll change next time:

  • To be determined
